WBkBdZ1ssyf8eeIEKUYHgQ.text: First time here. Not the best experience. Food was great, staff was nice. The mustard bottle they brought out had a hole in it so it splattered all over my shirt.  Mind you this was morning before work. They brought me napkins and soda water. No discount or offer to get my check. And when I asked for more coffee, it was discovered that I was given decaf which is not what I ordered.

E-jvjE2rwToSDYYDlYlRHA.text: In town for the Cowboy game and found this place on Yelp for breakfast. They use a team service concept which is fantastic and I wish more restaurants did this. Service and food were amazing! Justin the owner came by to check on us and stayed and talked for a while. We will definitely come back if we find ourselves in Charlotte again!

j32cY1ofek6ZuxPdQC2Vjg.text: Amazing service and even better food!  Probably best omelette ever!!! Raspberry pancake out of this world. Owner is ex pro football player and coach. He came over and chatted with us.   DONT let the location turn you away.  (It's in uptown--good--but downstairs in office building so no windows etc). But sooooo worth it.

JbF6cvhyJ6lfalCOGl1SMA.text: We visited this place a few times and each visit our family finds something special about the menu. My youngest daughter just loves the waffles and scrambled eggs! The Ruben sandwich is a most try as well. Besides the food I can not forget how well the staff paid attention to detail during our visit. Very friendly and polite! We will visit this establishment again ..

WOL_o4vGtaabOjTushyCBg.text: The service & the food was great. Here visiting, but I will definitely eat here again the next time I'm in town.

-9O9iFQdxC4PA86WikySjQ.text: Good little joint for breakfast or lunch. The breakfast potatoes were out of this world. Great vibe and the staff was super friendly!

ymZ2nJ97e1UguT0o82JMiA.text: The best place has the best OJ!  The service is good, it well lit and clean. This location has more seating downstairs or you can enjoy a street level view.

xYQrfK5fH6LBC5V3xT_GNA.text: Wonderful breakfast spot. I had the avocado omelet. The omelet was full of avocado and bacon, which was a perfect combination of creamy and salty. The breakfast potatoes were impeccably seasoned and honestly some of the best I've ever eaten. Highly recommend this eatery!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado omelet, breakfast potatoes, rye toast

1RwnTgs1xo9psfAf6RjI4w.text: Excellent service and the food was fabulous. Lizette was such a gracious hostess. So glad our party of six stopped here for brunch. Great experience.

VqiPkobrnL9sfdxRfe1AgA.text: Showed up by myself. Checked in with hostess. She said it would be a 20 min wait. And it was exactly a 20 minute wait. The rub was three couples showed up after I did and were given tables immediately. I finally also was offered a table. I asked the hostess if reservations were accepted and was informed no. I wasn't in a hurry but scratch my head in seating priorities.

aBYQ3vS-yXBlJHgI-F7d_g.text: We used Famous Toastery in Uptown for WeWork's International Women's Day brunch event and it was nothing less than fantastic. They responded quickly to our inquiry and offered a wide variety of catering options specifically tailored to our vegetarian need. Great service from start to finish. We can't wait to use them again! I also highly suggest you order the french toast casserole :)

PuV1VgWg9kzLvFLfFtQaDQ.text: My husband and I come here every single Saturday. We love this place! Great food and service. The French toast and avocado omelette are so so good.

6hUTRFqyV2p7EhPlG7ZGOA.text: This location has alcohol! Not apparent on the website. They really live by the motto "every server is your server". All the servers were so nice and helpful. The owner, Justin, stopped by our table as well. Plenty of gluten free options, such as french toast (a must have!) I will definitely be back. The food and service was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. The rumosa and bloody Mary

FY0C2T711K6EDeD6zhtIKw.text: Great breakfast place. It was a great walk uptown. The Hash special was wonderful and the OJ was wonderfully fresh.

vuOTscA6N-aKPzhVPVvqjw.text: Ate here on New Year's Day. The fresh orange juice is so delicious! Good atmosphere. Would have given them 4 stars, but they were running out of food; also, scrambled eggs were good, but not amazing. Macaroni and cheese is good. Clean bathroom.

vDmCpGGZkt-VRJJOMEA46A.text: Had Brunch, it was delicious! Service was great , everything was fresh and hot. I highly recommend

IXGMnYn5ilwXXlBpxdPvdA.text: I travel a lot and read reviews before I choose where to eat. Menu and reviews looked good...but this place was no better than a fast food joint that has omelets on the menu. Veggies in omelet weren't fresh, and it was sliced pre-packaged cheese. Just gross. Best part of the meal was fruit salad. Oh, the waiter was also either hungover or just super unhappy to be there.

e216XF950vZS66OzkZAzuw.text: We absolutely love breakfast food but rarely does a specific meal ever stand out, however this place has it figured out! Tried the Cali Benedict and endless refills of coffee. The Benedict was perfect but what really made me weak in the knees were the breakfast potatoes....WOW! Hands down the best potatoes I've ever eaten!  Great service, adorable little spot, phenomenal food. We'll be back!

0HMXj62NAtw9QmlgYS0GJA.text: I loooove this location.  It is right on time and convenient.  Grab n gos in the morning are convenient.

3lZNzBMRINxpRvD44izZYw.text: Food is SO good! Lots of options makes it hard to choose. Friendliest staff in all of Charlotte. Very fast and attentive service

mWl_rvoQ4OvH0NXBhaWaKA.text: Great find from Yelp reviews. The staff all work together making it a very friendly and attentive dining experience.  We were a two top and enjoyed the yogurt parfait, eggs and a turkey, melted brie cheese and raspberry puree. All fresh and delicious. The owner even stopped by to Thank you. Sir, you are welcome,  it was great. Compliments to you and the staff. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

UGhjRysj6-IVII8bBXrGHQ.text: First stop after arriving to visit Charlotte .  Very attentive service, I think every server assisted in service for our table. Had hash & eggs, hash was one of the best homemade ever had.  Also, lobster omelette was pretty good.  Had bloody Mary's nice touch to finish with. Can't wait to go back maybe lunch next time.

leheXJb2IKAk1BO-Ls8xPQ.text: We came here opening weekend and were very impressed! The food was delicious and reasonably priced, they had boozy coffee drinks, but the real difference was their customer service! Each server we spoke with was so nice and worked hard to make sure we had a great experience. The owner even stopped over at our table to make sure we enjoyed our meal. Definitely a great breakfast and we will be back!

npgc6TpzS8Z0CBj42pgUWw.text: Pretty great breakfast spot! My waffle was delicious, had fresh fruits on top of it with whipped cream. It was yummy! Their breakfast potatoes were seasoned well & delightful as well. Would definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

3i0UJqB1-o_0GwILCoEIOw.text: The service is excellent and the food is consistently good. I got the Country Benedict and French toast. They are delicious!!! Will definitely be back.

qbky5yUDOMRn8JesFwUe9A.text: Bangin!!!! This place was shake me and make sure I'm awake kinda good! Biscuits and Gravy is the best I ever had and I'm from the south where we serve it like most do ketchup. Staff was amazing, owner came over to say hello to us and every other table, served food, cleaned up, he was very invested in his business. Obviously why it's so successful even if he did go to Miss St. Next time I'm in Charlotte this will be my first stop!

sUV6oEyzSvA6gwvgWACSnA.text: I guess I'm not sure why this place gets such amazing reviews. The location is in the basement and I felt like the food was ok, nothing special, just your typical dinner breakfast variety. Service was good.

6daZPv367upijPmp9sPGaw.text: Me and my husband went there and ate breakfast while they were setting up for the ACC Tournament in Charlotte! The atmosphere was nice! The food was great. And the customer service was Good! I would recommend this spot to people looking for a nice breakfast spot!

x7X0lWJ0QGd327GzBCtC-g.text: My first experience at Famous Toastery was DEFINITELY not a good one. I have a lot of food allergies (I can eat mostly Paleo type foods) so I was VERY limited on choices. I decided to make it simple and order 3 poached eggs cooked medium, a side of bacon and a side of fruit. I also ordered a cup of coffee. We waited quite a while for our food to arrive. I was okay drinking my coffee but, after drinking about half of my coffee I noticed there was some disgusting brown gunk stuck on the inside of my glass. I don't get-easily grossed out but this almost made me gag.  Then, when receiving my order, my eggs were awful! I had to send them back and then wait longer for my second batch. THESE eggs  pictured here are the SECOND batch I received. These are the worst poached medium eggs I've ever received at a restaurant! Keep in mind I paid $12 for this breakfast, not including my coffee. Other than the kind waiter I was very disappointed. It would have been nice for them to at least not charge me for the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

8mVtUuPE3Beicyk4aRBrYw.text: A great breakfast spot! Bright sunny decor. Very good service, I was able to come into restaurant before they officially opened and have coffee while waiting for my friend. Large menu with sweet and savory items. I was coming from downtown and loved being able to take the light rail and just walk a short distance. My friend appreciated the nearby parking. Great choice all around!!

3yFe0jP-QjJGgHjlx-oVyQ.text: Not even satisfying. I designate the one star I have to give to the waiter staff. From the coffee to the redo on the french toast - everything was luke warm, bland and just yuck. We got the hash that everyone raves about and I question those reviewers. The french toast was Runny, gummy, wet. The bacon was chewy. The orange juice was sooooo far from freshly squeezed. My feelings are just hurt. My only breakfast opportunity in this city this weekend and it was ruined by less than average breakfast items... coffee was  extremely weak too. Which is probably  why I was cranky writing his review. I'm headed to get crepes to turn around this breakfast experience. I'm not leaving pictures because I'll save you the despair.

MKGsT-xP-bzaCM7B17yj3Q.text: We went on a Sunday. I ordered the avocado omelet and my family, a party of 7 adults 1 child, ordered a variety of things including a tennessee espresso. The espresso was a hit! The service was awesome. Our waitress Chris definitely made the dining experience easy to enjoy. I personally hate dining at small tables because of the potential clutter . Chris stayed on top of the cleanliness of our table.  While packing up my nephew spilled his chocolate milk from his to-go cup. I thought for sure my sister would be charged a third milk but Chris was happy to refill it and Robert was happy to clean up the mess. The place was not crowded, the service was great and my avocado omelet was the best omelet I've had in a long time. (My husbands stuffed french toast was great too )

bTuPTmQdUbgCpsHXYUOO2w.text: It was my first time at the Famous Toastery and clearly won't be my last. I was greeted and seated immediately. Coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice arrived immediately. I love the fact they say "every waiter is your waiter".  Coffee was refilled as often as I wanted. I ordered the MBS omelet (mushroom, bacon and Swiss) which was out in under five minutes.  Enough for two people for sure!  Definitely worth trying when you're in Charlotte Uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

ATnDLlY3hd5Znvt7d6LehA.text: Excellent service. I went there on a Sunday morning for breakfast. The Panthers were playing the Falcons minus Cam. But that's another story. Needless to say the joint was packed. I went there solo so I just needed a seat somewhere to eat. At the front door the hostess guided me down stairs to avoid a long wait to see if they could slip me in somewhere. The downstairs hostess was welcoming and pointed me towards the lady doing the seating. They both suggested hanging loose until a bar seat came open or wait 40 minutes. I slid into a bar seat in 5 minutes and enjoyed my meal.

DVqQw8VVOL4MMwe7SanRUg.text: Great menu and food! Loud though during the weekday for lunch!! Server was not great. When my friend order his lunch, she asked if the standard side was okay. He asked if there are other options, and she laughed a bit and then  proceeded to point at the menu that she already took from him and was sitting on the edge of the table and said here they are verse just telling him. I thought it was a bit off putting.

vHddTTtETP-gmcGxQJ2yvw.text: Great meal. Greeted by lovely ladies at the hostess desk. Food was delivered by the owner, a very pleasant and friendly young man. Loved the avocado Benedict. My husband left the coffee - and he is very hard to please when it comes to that.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

0_RunZo946r-8vXXDPUdwA.text: First time visiting, definitely won't be the last. I had the avocado omelette with potatoes and a Bloody Mary. Everything was excellent, to include the service and timeliness of being seated. Thank you for a great breakfast!

R2jeh-GSFZRYWOzWWYPVxw.text: Great, local place.  The food is AWESOME, and they operate on "team service."  Versus having just one sever, the entire wait staff can help you.  10/10 recommend.

FD3RuEag4KI9svVE3h5LHQ.text: Finding the location makes you feel like you're in a game putting clues, directions together to reach where you want to get... Service is great, so is food. Visited during a busy weekend and was not disappointed. Cali Benedict was delicious!

rtlwk3f68ZdLdl-fRt1YQQ.text: The best biscuits and gravy i have ever had ! The potato's were also delicious. Small and tucked away but packed a big punch ! The atmosphere was lovely and the servers all worked together to make the best experience.

AX6Sd0WqW__5aXSbBhkh8g.text: Grabbed breakfast here a few time- takeout and dine in.  Coffee is pretty good:) food is fresh and yummy:) take out and dine in are quick:) service is fast, attentive:) can't complain! I'd recommend it, for sure!

Yy4H-s1Ok0VmCr8td0NEbg.text: While walking to try to find Rhino Market, we accidentally found Toastery!!   The entrance is is located in a weird spot and kinda hard to describe.  We had to get on an elevator, go down a floor and then walk down the hall.  There are plenty of signs though to help direct you! It was almost like we were going to a secret club.  I also stood next to someone in Bon Jovi's band.  Apparently they were in Town for a concert the night before.  Phil X was his name.  Pretty cool.  Food/service was good and consistent with the other location on park road.

rcJIvtQyAB4_MGGsSC5nQw.text: This place was very busy when we went because there was a festival outside. However, my coffee took about 20 minutes to arrive and was lukewarm when it did. Next, when my food actually arrived it was a non-vegetarian dish so I could not eat it and had to send it back. When it finally did, it was also cold. The food itself was fine but had a very strange experience so would check out one of the other amazing restaurants in Charlotte instead!

tZe-U9NbuXimbQSgE3qN3A.text: Was in Charlotte for business and wanted to grab a relaxed breakfast. I saw the reviews for this place and given it was just a block or so from my hotel, decided to check it out. I'm happy that I did. As others have noted the service was very good. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and was amazing. I made my own "blah blah blah" omelette and had a latte.  Everything was very good.   The restaurant is tucked into the bottom floor of an office building, and was quiet and relaxed.

zOWV3nSYmUaAplHVgwUtkQ.text: The staff was very attentive and nice at this location. The left coast BLT was really good.

Y_Z-EuPTsAYhib2ZEFjB-Q.text: My friend and I took her two very picky kids here for lunch. Her four year old decorated it the best French toast ever and ate the whole plate. Her daughter thought she was getting "grown up" macaroni and cheese but got kid mac and cheese. They were completely ready to take it away and replace it for free but she ended up loving it. Great staff...great food!

wHaz7gy5ga0Wfc_sXqmVYQ.text: The service was super slow, we ordered at 11:45am and it was 12:30 before we saw our waiter again, our drinks had not been refilled and when we got our food the plates where dirty. Will not come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

LNDQcjeq4wXL5zfBbiEsUQ.text: We were looking for a breakfast place downtown and saw this one on yelp and it had positive reviews. It was good food. Fast service and  a typical breakfast place. It was decorated nicely and the bathrooms were clean. The grits were delicious and the egg white omelet huge.

6pII_gDkn71LyCMPECtZdw.text: Had a disappointing experience at the Famous Toastery Uptown. My husband and I waited 30 minutes for our food and it came out cold. He ordered the eggs Benedict and the English muffin was hard and he couldn't cut it. He also asked for no tomato (simple enough request) and it came out with tomato. My stuffed French toast had brown bananas and didn't taste great. The orange juice was amazing and the service was good, but the food was very disappointing.

Veswu2F8SpKq4UZbkzJz1w.text: We were in Charlotte to celebrate my birthday and this place was recommended by the concierge at the Marriott. Breakfast was delicious, the coffee and service were both great, and when I complained that my toast wasn't "toasted" enough it was whisked away and replaced. The owner, Justin Griffith, joined us for a chat at our table, which was a real treat! Would recommend!

r2W5kNbtLAbkIbRXetrkeQ.text: Our canvassing of Wells Fargo and Bank of America was a tremendous success. Serveral people signed up to volunteer. I also had the pleasure of having brunch at Famour Toastery. The coffee is divine. "Lavazza coffee is actually from Hawaii not Itally," my co-protestor replied to my very off the cuff remark of how I loved Itallian coffee. The emblem, "Lavazza," was artfully displayed on the cappuccino cup. I love good coffee and the staff was more than willing to provide top offs and to go cups on the house. We were canvassing at the Pride Parade for ActionNC, soliciting signatures from venders and participants alike. Wells Fargo did a terrific job of selecting socially conscience venders. AIDS research, LBGTQ advocacy, the ACLU, and the Peace Corp were all represented among others.. Given the broad array of positive social actors providing great information, I was dissapointed to be one of the groups who were protesting Wells Fargo and their sister institution BofA. The Wells Fargo Foundation is over 30 million invested Geo Group and Core Civic, two of the industry leaders in private prison management, and detention centers. Some of those facilities have recently been featured in the news due to the Zero Tolerance policies of the current administration. Private prisons are businesses that profit from human suffering and racial imbalance. They provide incentives to unfairly incarcerate members of certain communities. They leave a wake of destruction in the form of emasculated ommunites and separated families. The food at Famous Toastery was above par. Breakfast anytime is a hard sell for me but everyone was pleasantly surprised. The manager, a bald gent, made sure our orders were accurate. He was relentless as a server. Relentless in the good way that only a manager who takes pride in their work can be. At first I thought he was the owner but then I realized that every employee seemed equally invested. Leading from the front; a terrific leadership strategy. That is a tried True trickle down theory. I wish Wells Fargo would continue to lead from the front with regards to private prisons and ICE related detention centers. Wells Fargo is a proud institution in the City of Charlotte but the sort of corporate double speak that they are currently engaged in is reprehensible. To support such diverse groups and yet invest in detention centers, and the private prison industry is hypocritical. It makes zero sense Wells Fargo and others have essentially sold their corporate souls for 30 pieces of silver. Great Coffee. prisondivest.com/2018/07...

_3-fTQDwe3a52i9ubYuWgA.text: After reading all the great reviews, I was excited to try out the brunch here. I ordered the "strawberry & cream cheese" stuffed French toast with bacon. I was really disappointed that the French toast wasn't stuffed with strawberries AND cream cheese the way it was described on the menu. The filling was strawberry flavored cream cheese (the kind you buy in tub at the grocery store to put on bagels) and there were some cut up strawberries lying on top of the French toast. The dish didn't have much flavor, but the presentation was nice.

CP9i5K1KLcsTgTeE2ymXfg.text: Went here for Saturday morning breakfast with my little cousin before heading down the street to Discovery Place. There's a main entrance off the side street at the corner of Tryon which I didn't realize at first. We went in that door and were sent downstairs (also no idea they had a downstairs) to a separate hostess to be seated. We were promptly seated and serviced. The food was very good and ample portions. I had an omelet with breakfast potatoes and toast, my cousin had chocolate chip pancakes with eggs. Overall great experience, I will definitely be back when I'm looking for a solid Saturday breakfast Uptown.

trtzvpwoAJNX6C-6OR00qg.text: We are in town for vacation and this place for breakfast was awesome. The waitress put a spin on my flight mimosa and they were the best. I had a biscuit and gravy with sausage. The biscuits was soft and fluffy. The gravy was robust with flavor. Great breakfast spot.

ybZBRy5hPXdJ4T6xbxT_qQ.text: First breakfast while visiting Charlotte.  The service was quick, but there were a few snafus. 1) the creamers at the table were spoiled.  Had to have the coffee replaced twice 2) One of the orders were completely wrong.  My friend was given the wrong food.  Although they did their best to remake it, I was already done eating by the time that they arrived with the correct plate of food. 3) The cornbread should be at least room temperature...it was refrigerator cold. :-(   Other than that, the place was clean and the staff were friendly.

2JXIfmT3X8IX42LBqwytpA.text: We were in from Atlanta and staying at a nearby hotel. We came and ate here every morning of our trip. The food is delicious. They offered several specials each day, had plenty of healthy options and choices to satisfy our whole family.  The service was outstanding. We were especially impressed that the owner, Justin Griffith, greeted patrons, as were we fans of his from his years on the Atlanta Falcons. We will be sure to come back when we are in Charlotte. What a very pleasant yummy atmosphere tucked away. Make the visit!!!!

XmBMrywcq0I5sRbJCBaVXw.text: Very average, not worth a 30 minute wait for sure. Service was very slow and inattentive, food was ok but not great by any standard. Two of us asked for crispy bacon on the side and it was put in the food making it soggy, very strange since we both clearly said "a side of crispy bacon". Drinks were completely empty and we had to find server and request refills before given.  Will not return again.

6pZv0Qa_xEK8ElmMo2JpKw.text: This is hands down my favorite brunch spot in town. The service is always great, food is amazing, and I've never had to wait to be seated or wait long on food. Every server is your server so you never have to wait long for anything- refills, check, etc.   I know it sounds silly- but the waffles are to die for. I know you're probably thinking it's just a waffle....but trust me. Just try it! The grits are amazing (even plain...no cheese or sugar needed). The country benedict is amazing...the gravy is very good southern gravy! (With sausage). I normally order the potatoes extra crispy. Coffee is also great- stronger than most.   The uptown location is a little odd/hard to find and there is no outdoor seating. Great portion sizes...you will leave FULL :)

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Country benedict with sausage
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waffle with berry compote
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. From the griddle combo sub waffle and grits...berry compote on the side

cCTgUCkL8KFjCweMYoVueA.text: Food was ok, service was a bit slow - I thinks contributed to our food being cold, when we got it. OJ was really fresh and Good. Location is in the basement of an office building- so no natural light.

gmNcQIWkgZFZyCgRgH0-sg.text: Terrible to go orders! Don't ever order to go. Missing major items and the huevos rancheros was the worst I've ever had in my life. There wasn't even chips in it. Black beans and eggs and a tiny pinch of feta and tomatoes. It was disgusting. Trash. I've dined in there before once as well and the food quality does not match the price at all. Dodge this place if you can.

0g2dBjf7-9N52AuQRbsVhA.text: Great portion sizes. And fresh ingredients. Came in for breakfast and got "The Burrito" with turkey sausage . Having a turkey option for breakfast often gets lost in transition so I'm thankful they offer it here. The burrito is jammed pack with veggies eggs, cheese and turkey sausage. It was $10 which is about on par for Uptown eating but the Burrito was big. Also you can get a flour or spinach wrap like I did. Definitely would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Burrito with turkey sausage

4P-bFF4erx2T3AOuDoKA1A.text: Great service and food was delicious.  Servings are plentiful, I will return.  Omelettes are stuffed full and very tasty!  Fast service and the staff is very attentive.

nCmA7sj-dIEkPV09q_ViWw.text: Good service. Odd location that feels as though you are heading to an office cafeteria. The food was good, the corned beef hash was not something I would order again with alot of potaotes and minimal corned beef. The eggs were perfectly cooked and a delicious hollandaise sauce.

qSheah5bGKlNrA6yili74A.text: I love the Famous Toastery.  I was excited that they were opening a location uptown near my work.   We went for a team celebration  today for breakfast.  I ordered my usual, the left coast blt with fruit.  My coworkers got some different varieties of omelettes that they were really pleased with!   The service was incredible.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Left coast blt

cgJ2_HkLrda__WkrjO9f-Q.text: Decent food. A confusing layout on how to get to it. Two different entrances. A long wait on a Sunday morning. They should raise prices during busy times, to scale back the wait.   The "every server is your server" concept is novel but not the effective is practice.   Should have shredded potatoes. Good iced tea!

ZiYqQqK6HDKlXJU3WA1Yyg.text: Classic breakfast place in the center of downtown Charlotte. Fast service, great food and a bar! I had the huevos rancheros, which was tasty. We also enjoyed mimosas. Service is fast and staff was very attentive - southern hospitality at its best.  It's located in a building with other businesses but the signs make it extremely easy to find. We look forward to coming back.

DBCsLShWYx0Eq5xe6DbGBQ.text: In town for the ACC tournament and decided to eat here. I ordered breakfast. Nothing out of the ordinary. The service is great. If I eat there again I would probably go with the lunch menu.

U5x3I23rVhE_GCg7T1W0TA.text: My folks saw this place advertised on the news as a must-do for brunch or breakfast. They brought me here during a recent visit over Labor Day weekend.   It is located in the same parking lot as JT Posh, with a few designated spots in front of the restaurant. We arrived about an hour after opening, which someone from the wait staff said was ideal if you're trying to beat the crush of people coming in.   They let us choose our seats and grabbed drinks quickly while we looked over the menu. In addition to the regular menu, they offer daily specials. I went back and forth on a special versus a breakfast sandwich, but decided on the breakfast sandwich with egg, bacon, and cheese on sourdough bread. I also added a side of their potatoes.  It's a restaurant where everyone is your waiter - if you need something, you can flag down any of the wait staff for assistance. We rarely needed to get anyone's attention as those who passed our table were very attentive and quick to ask about refills or checking on how we were doing. I was amazed that one of the guys offered to grab more water for my tea free of charge - most of the places I order hot tea from it's limited to a single cup or a small teapot if you're in a nicer place.   Breakfast sandwich was excellent - bread was toasted, cheese perfectly melted, and the egg ratio on the sandwich was perfect. (Sometimes the restaurants overcompensate on eggs and the other ingredients are lost.) The potatoes were cooked well and had a bit of spice on them - my mom complained they were too spicy but I felt it was just right.  One drawback to the restaurant is table size - if you have 3-4 people at one square table and you're ordering large meals, you might struggle to have enough room for everything on the table. We sort of had to play jigsaw puzzle with placing glasses and plates carefully on the table without knocking things over.  I'd come back here again for the food and fantastic service.

ZJ5SFzydPTgEOd071Erh7Q.text: A super reliable breakfast place.  I was in town for HeroesCon like I typically am most years and there's always the dilemma of where to eat breakfast. Do you eat some place downtown that's in walking distance or drive to someplace close by since Charlotte has a ton of amazing restaurants all over the city. The Famous Toastery has a new location in uptown that is very close to the convention center. Barley a 5 minute walk (and walking in uptown Charlotte is a delight).  They are located right off Tryon st. It's a little hidden since you walk into an office building and take an elevator down a floor. Once there it's very easy to find and they have lots of seating. The Famous Toastery is very much a traditional breakfast diner with more flare then an IHop or Waffle House. They have a very large and diverse menu. As someone that loves breakfast food I love poring over their extensive menu and wondering what to get.   I settled on their Famous Hash (corned beef ad shredded potatoes topped with eggs any style and hollandaise sauce). It's all the things I love in a breakfast item. It also comes with your choice of bread side (toast, muffin, etc...) It was terrific. All the breakfast elements I love in once place. I couldn't ask for more.   I was incredibly satisfied with my experience here. My only criticism is they didn't have any iced coffee which in 2018 seems like a weird choice. Its a little thing, but I do love my Iced Coffee.   If you're looking for a very dependable breakfast place that's quick and has lots of options this is your place.

iHB6iOQSNUzWFpxDRWDm2A.text: This was one of the first restaurants where I dined when I first moved here. The wait time was a little extreme but I understand why. The food was really good and they had options I thought I would only get by making them at home!

HJlBBY5QyqXZlSjt7GpHvA.text: Weird location underground in an office building. Food was just ok, nothing special. Also the service was not very good. None of the waiters were assigned to a table, and therefore there was some continuing confusion in terms of who was doing what. Had to ask twice for water for example. While Charlotte clearly is lacking in the breakfast offering, we do not plan to return to this place.

sVbVjrJIyh7wd33aA77AfQ.text: Mehh....   The service is good but not great, and the food is good just nothing special. This place gets packed on the weekends and is a great spot for brunch.

KO7Os04aOb1GMjvPJu04Qw.text: I thought the food was pretty good. The only thing that threw me off was there score which was a 94 or 95 I believe. To me that's a low score for such a great place so I wondered why they received that score. I must say the wait was 20-30 mins but luckily my friends and I sat at the bar which was just as good.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs any style meal with a choice of breakfast meat added and an ice caramel macchiato

naN-3MDGQ9O-CCT8QYPZkQ.text: Great coffee.  Great eggs and toast.  Great service.  Great everting except the biscuits and gravy.  Not. A.  Fan.  Too greasy tasting.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh fruit bowl.  Very good!!

Wjm20Hk3Pgcu3tZ9nXGyRQ.text: Fantastic service by Chris red haired waitress! I had the Avocado Benedict which was yummy and filling. My husband had the traditional Eggs Bene and gave it two thumbs up!  coffee to go was a nice add. Will come back and highly recommend.

ZDfYnNRYxnsvKxI27Dj46g.text: The food came out super fast and very delicious! The servers were super friendly especially Mason. We were have a difficult time deciding what we wanted to order and he made great suggestions to choice from. I will definitely be coming back and try more things off the menu

1UrUPu_DQ3cjQi78TzBERw.text: Someone needs to update the Postmates menu.... perhaps take Cinnamon Raisin Bread OFF the list of bread choices under WRAPS. That was literally the most disgusting chicken bacon wrap I've ever had... because it came on Cinnamon Raisin Bread. My fault for not noticing. But seriously, help a girl out.

esLfsqDedue0pvAfZFlruw.text: I wish I could give more than 5 stars! The food and service were incredible. We got to chat with the owner Justin and his wife Kim, and they were so pleasant and welcoming. It is evident that the staff are happy to work there because of their great leadership. Justin and Kim are truly amazing and it was a pleasure to get to know them. I would highly recommend stopping by the Famous Toastery for an excellent meal and welcoming environment. Prices are very affordable. Service was quick. We will definitely be back. Thank you for an outstanding experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

cvj3JPV6adj9q2YJAHqZaw.text: Thought this place was ok, the location was weird, in a basement in uptown. But no complaints about the food or the wait staff

yJ_RpZhMHT7m389SuFLy3w.text: Toast makes its way Uptown...yay! I'm a fan...except of only the upstairs.  We parked on a side street around 9:00 a.m. and felt like we were the early bird diners and I'm glad it was that way because the restaurant was quiet. We did enter through the basement of sorts in the office building and were asked if we wanted downstairs or upstairs. So we walked through the downstairs which felt, literally, like a cafeteria, and when we went upstairs were pleasantly surprised with what felt like, well, a wonderful cafe with great windows and light.  I wouldn't eat in the lower floor, so we'll probably still find our way to Dilworth unless we knowingly are awake before the breakfast crowd rush (9:30 a.m.) to guarantee a seat upstairs  Service was AWESOME. we had such a sweet, bubbly blonde whom I wish I remembered her name because we was fabulous.  The food runners were kind as well, and just everyone seemed to be in a good mood.

uQEQ7vJWWBlKGx3NdUog4g.text: Great food and great location. I've been here a few times, and I've yet to be disappointed. I came for brunch a few months ago with my girlfriend with a reservation we put in ahead of time. When we got there, the waitress was confused on where to seat us even though there were multiple empty tables which was a bit strange.  Anyways, I ordered the 'Avocado Benedict', and my gf ordered the '2 eggs any style' (she ordered them sunny side up) which came with her choice of bread and breakfast potatoes. We also shared a plate of french toast and a glass of freshly squeezed OJ.   Everything was delicious! We were stuffed and stuck in a food coma as soon as we got home. Definitely recommend.

TqtTkfsbu5d83LFjhUFODA.text: As a visitor to Charlotte, I might have had a hard time finding this location but luckily there are plenty of signs pointing you in the right direct, and I was with some smart and knowledgeable Charlotte residents :) Located in the basement of the building. We came on a Sunday after church and were sat immediately, despite having a large-ish group.   There's something for everyone - kids and adults. The menu is mostly typical for brunch food. Good service - our coffees were refilled and refilled, and the food was good. Great potatoes :) Nothing was out of the world.. except... and I feel like this is quite a bold claim - but best. pancakes. ever. If you like pancakes with texture and some crisp to them! I wish I had gotten a stack of these instead of whatever I had ordered! I can hardly even remember what I ordered other than the pancake! (That's a lie I do remember. it was the corned beef hash and I liked it. But the pancake was the star of my breakfast that stole the show.)  I only got one pancake and I had gotten it in addition to my meal to share with my husband, but unfortunately for him he only got a few bites!!!!

4MYFocJFNXLFWyrJKBYpqw.text: This place is just OK.   Food: The food is bland despite having a variety of ingredients.   Drink:  mimosa was awesome! (Hence 3 stars)  Service: nice but slowwwwwww. I waited a good 15 mins for the waiter to come with a box and the check.  Price: $10 for an omelet.  Update: reduced 1 star for this "bacon avocado melt" that had no bacon, wasn't remotely melted and on stale bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

2qLiv16_4CCtmcIjQdYbjQ.text: I'm giving them a half star for having a nice server. Half a star for letting me include an order of salsa and Pico de Gallo for our eggs.     My husband and I arrived at 9:30 for breakfast on a Friday. It was not crowded. Nice atmosphere, very cold in room. We enjoyed coffee for me, a decent but forgettable Bloody Mary for him. We ordered a combo, two eggs( scrambled)  a flapjack, sausage for me , bacon for him. After a pretty long wait, it arrived in containers, in a carry out bag at our table. We looked shocked..the girl at counter said, "they are eating here!" After a few minutes, our plates arrived. They had dumped the food on cold plates, didn't reheat anything. Our eggs were ice cold. They finally remembered the salsa...to dump on ice cold eggs. Our pancakes were ice cold. No butter on them or offered, it wouldn't melt anyway. Then it took a few minutes and they brought some cold syrup to put on it. Awful! No excuse, but pitiful management. Another couple beside us got a visit from either chef or management to apologize about forgetting order and comped them. They said they had waited 40 minutes. We heard lots of cutting up behind the scenes, seems delivering a prompt hot breakfast is not important. Very unimpressed.

5tOMFkXtrpPHAyRcvv_kug.text: I came here for brunch a few weekends ago, and I can't believe what I was missing out on. Affordable prices for phenomenal breakfast/lunch options. We put in a reservation ahead of time and we got there, and the waitress was confused on where to seat us even though I saw like 7 tables that were empty, so that was kinda weird.   Anyways, I ordered the '2 eggs any style' which came with...2 eggs any style lol (I did sunny side up), my choice of multigrain bread, and breakfast potatoes. My bf ordered the avocado benedict which was so delicious, and we both shared french toast. My bf also ordered freshly squeezed OJ, and I ordered a hot chocolate. Let's just say we were both STUFFED.   I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two eggs any style, French toast, and avocado Benedict = DELICIOUS

-3Ux07-UDG852Mvu8dotnw.text: Great place for breakfast! We tried an egg breast and french toast platter - both were delicious. The portions are very generous. The service was great too. We would highly recommend eating here.   We were a little bit confused on how to access the restaurant - you have to go into an office building, take an elevator down, then walk down a hallway to get to the restaurant area.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, and toast

Kky3W2cBek85qW4mxOHMkQ.text: In town for a conference so decided to stop by this spot I found on Yelp for a sit down breakfast. Located in an office building downstairs so no off-street presence. Plenty of space and seating available. Very clean decor and atmosphere. I ordered the breakfast burrito on spinach tortilla. From order to the table was pretty quick. For $8 I was surprised at the small portion with nothing additional. Food tasted well but nothing breath taking. Pros are: very friendly staff, fast service and food was descent. Don't really have a con, was just underwhelmed with portion. It was really just a small sandwich and not a burrito as I was expecting. So for me it was average, nothing more and nothing less.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

Fhk88OpHnz0YkCMcuS4mIw.text: We are in the Charlotte area this weekend for vacation. We heard this place had great food. So we walked from our hotel to the restaurant. Before I do my review of the food I did want to mention that since this restaurant is in the heart of downtown so the only issue you may have is finding parking. We walked so we had no issues with parking. Also, the restaurant is below.  Now let's talk about the food. It was delicious! I had the breakfast combo and that came with bacon, two eggs and a waffle(which comes with delicious whip cream and berries. Again that was an excellent choice! A friend of mine had the avocado Benedict and said it was delicious as well! Let's not talk about the drinks! They were on point! I definitely recommend you stopping by this restaurant if you are visiting or living in Charlotte area.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo of Waffle, bacon and eggs scrambled with cheese!

G0_PNLshq9U6bQanuKna-Q.text: Millennials get a bad rep for getting avocado toast, but have you tried an avocado omelette before doe. Trust me, it will probably be the best few dollars you will ever spend, so save that cup of joe for next time, and grab yourself an avocado omelette. I recommend building your own omelette with Lox, American Cheese, and AVOCADO.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lox Omelette with American Cheese and Avocado

bzDyfonm86WbiVAicgrvrw.text: Everyone is so friendly and I always have a great experience. Lily has been phenomenal as well as the other lady working the register this morning!

aCaOF9OeVsbiiDlmsOVtPQ.text: Visited Charlotte for a quick stay and was looking for quality breakfast food. This place was recommended by a friend and was in the vicinity of our hotel. You will need to take an elevator to the entrance but there are plenty of signs that will help you get there. The wait staff was extremely helpful and I love how they are all willing to jump in and assist if you can't track down your designated waiter. I had the crab cake scramble and it was amazing! They give a good portion of food  but it's not  overwhelming which is excellent. It hits the spot and you are left satisfied. Definitely check this place out!

aUH4Q7cC7iL0k-NAFCrCkA.text: Enjoyed Sunday brunch here with friends! When we arrived we were immediately greeted with very pleasant hostesses. We had a small wait, but it went quickly. There is plenty of seating upstairs and down and is great for larger groups. They operate under a server share style (any server can assist you and they split tips).   Everything came out perfect and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their choices! I definitely recommend the potatoes, waffle, and my husband loved his corn beef hash. I liked that they give you the ability to choose the level of spice you want for your Bloody Mary. It was the perfect combo of mild with a little spice and it definitely delivered!   We will definitely be back next time we are out for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States

cXyw0tl6MjOjHlfR1sNGMw.text: Good was delicious, service was amazing and so were the drinks.... Its located on the LL of an office building. When we arrived, there was a 20 min wait but i believe we were texted stating our table was ready in lesser time.  Food Ordered: Burger (comes with other side options besides french fries) SMG - which was a breakfast platter A portabello and roasted veggie wrap And a mexican omelette Every dish was tasty, not one complaint I will be in Charlotte soon so i will be coming back again

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Man-mosa
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double Bloody Mary

vZnn8udqwUD2YvleqYpwjA.text: Good hearty breakfast on the lower level of an office building. Fresh and delicious orange juice. Typical, hearty breakfast with good service. A nice spot to have a quiet breakfast underground.

33wOo6umquju1A_ENBF1Hg.text: This place has mediocre food and makes little attempt to compensate for their mistakes. $11 Eggs Benedict looks like this. My boyfriends food came out completely cold. Will not return or recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. $11 eggs Benedict

YZc14Lf-rMLaehg4kLP1MA.text: Luckily this place was open on New Years Day before I left to head back home so I gave it a try. It's a sit yourself style place but I'm sure since it was holiday, it was a little calmer than normal (especially since it's the uptown location). The menu has plenty of options to choose from for a reasonable price as well. For two people, it was around $22. I had the Florentine Benedict with a side of potatoes and my friend ordered the Stuffed French Toast with a side of bacon. Everything came out pretty quickly and server was very friendly. Definitely try them out if you're looking for quick yet yummy breakfast/brunch food!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Florentine Benedict (Hollandaise Sauce on the side) and side of potatoes

NuKz3Bg4XGOHZHQ6BcQRBQ.text: This restaurant had a nice, dependable breakfast. I got two scrambled eggs, a cup of berries, cinnamon toast, and an americano. My husband had a hash benedict thing that he really enjoyed. There were lots of other delicious sounding items on the menu that I would explore next time. i do wish they had yogurt, since this is my go-to breakfast item.  This place is located half underground with no windows and a kind of lousy ambiance, and then half at street level with more light. I'd probably try to eat at street level next time.  The service was nice, and there were plenty of creamers, butters and jams on the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two scrambled eggs with a side of berries and cinnamon toast

Q84hd6ArVdqwax09s5clWw.text: Great food!  Just be aware once you get the food there is no follow up service. Refills on drinks or anything else  you have to go to the bar. The model is you have to get up a catch a server as they do not round back in the tables .

MJtShzWPQ4L2b4oI2mDxLQ.text: Sunday morning breakfast.  Kind of a hometown diner feel. Service was good but nothing special.  They have a decent breakfast menu.  There is a lot of egg options, breakfast burritos, pancakes and French toast to name a few. I ordered French toast with bacon and red potatoes on the side.  My son ordered eggs Benedict with bacon and potatoes. The potatoes were really good.  They could have used a little more salt but I added it at the table. My French toast was okay but needed some vanilla. The bacon was cooked and tasted good. My son said his eggs were cooked perfect and enjoyed his potatoes and bacon. The price was reasonable for what we ordered. The ambiance was quiet and clean for a Sunday morning. Coffee was also good. Nothing knocked my socks off making me want to return. In my opinion it was just okay.  A decent filling breakfast at a decent price. It came to around $30 including tip for breakfast for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kitchen is downstairs
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Famous Toastery Uptown - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seating area

dQTFh7p9502ppOnz4xz9zA.text: We really enjoyed our trip to this diner, even though we got lost through the back entrance and ate in the cave.  We'll definitely try again through the main entrance and finding seating in the upper deck!  I liked the wall art, and we were a bit overwhelmed by the choices.  I got a hot chocolate, which is the only thing I regret ordering.  I ordered two main plates--a BYO omelette and a Benedict.  Both were delish.    My counterparts had the flavored waffles.  Apparently the blueberry was fabulous.  The apple, not so much.    The prices weren't too steep and it was nice to be able to flag down any server.  We weren't sure if we had to take the check up ourselves or if someone would take care of it for us.  We asked, and a server answered that she could take care of it--but in a way that we couldn't tell if she was doing us a favor or if this was the standard.  So we still don't know what we are _supposed_ to be doing...  Oh well.  We'll be back.

vCp8t8eY-FDfb0FmZ155tA.text: Overall a pretty good place for breakfast!  I went here on a busy Sunday morning, and thankfully it was only about a 15 minute wait.  The waiters are super friendly, but say that their policy is that everyone is your waiter. Sounds great, but there were times were waiting for just anyone to come and take our order. A solid 10 mins went by before someone took at least a drink order.  Otherwise the food was delicious. I had the breakfast burrito and requested turkey sausage to be put in for extra flavor. I highly suggest this for those who have big appetites! My friend ordered the french toast and was easily impressed by its flavor and simplicity.  Avoid the hot chocolate because they just use the grocery store packets. Womp womp. Otherwise it seemed like the bloody marys and mimosas were popular so I would give that a try!

11Vaqivqc5X_MtA0tpVnFQ.text: We are visiting for the weekend and set out to find a great breakfast place. GUYS! This place is amazing. The food is genuine, delicious, and the servings are huge. Their prices are amazing too. I got the biscuits and gravy, and we both got a mimosa pitcher. The gravy was out of this world! The mimosas are a great deal and have home made fresh squeezed OJ. By far one of the highest quality mimosas I've had in my life. Our waitress, Kris, was the sweetest lady. She helped us decide what to get and was extremely attentive to our table. Amazing service and amazing food. We will be back on our next trip to charlotte!

AWKEef8Vv7EBRFtN1EEvNg.text: Great little joint for breakfast! The servers were super friendly and attentive. It's just a short walk from the downtown Hilton and conference center. They have menu options for health-conscious and vegetarian diners, as well as classic menu items for those who want a more traditional breakfast. The service was quick, our orders were correct, and (especially important before a long drive home) our coffee mugs stayed filled. Highly recommend!

JSEA_rEOaCi6JloeM0otzg.text: Discovered a great breakfast cafe Uptown and open on the weekend.  Good menu, service and food.  Just right.

n8Ji0gifTr4Ndp6VtYy42w.text: SOOOOOOO glad Downtown has this option. Lunch options while working downtown are great, but bringing the Famous Toastery in is a game-changer. Breakfast.all.day. The Turkey and Brie melt is a definate favorite. Also love that every server is your server. Feels like someone is always looking out for your table.

pdpMwE2FWROlrnmloZ2vbg.text: Excellent service and great food. My wife and I have been to other Famous Toastery locations in Charlotte metro and this one stands out. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. The coffee is superior to other locations. Give it a try for breakfast or lunch if you are uptown. We will be back soon!

2auUwUWkq2VhpA6Vm2-yKw.text: Great breakfast, lots of variety on menu.  We just happened on this place when visiting Charlotte for the first time.  Classic and Country Benedict were awesome.  Everything from the biscuit, eggs, and fruit were fresh.  Staff was very courteous, friendly, and attentive.  It was reasonably priced.

YBH7Kg749N7n1cOB4jw8xw.text: That was disappointing.  I had really high hopes for the biscuit sandwich.  But it lacked any flakiness and was almost soggy.  The staff are super pleasant and responsive. But between my sandwich and my guest's chorizo scramble, I don't expect much from the rest of the menu choices.

KNlnAyFhPoUgghMYRWh61g.text: Delicious food, wide variety of options for brunch and lunch with great service. Not the most aesthetic restaurant but a nice affordable place in the middle town near many other sights and sounds of the city.

lGk48lsN5Obnxp69E8-RiA.text: We felt so at home at the new Toastery in uptown Charlotte!  It just opened and we received excellent service and the food was amazing!  The atmosphere was really relaxing and nothing could have made it a better experience!  Great kids menu with chocolate chip pancakes and fruit!  Wonderful banana and walnut crepes! Thanks for making our visit to Charlotte a little like home.

sTwNkaNtVs6_SNBB4_Q-vA.text: This is THE place Uptown for breakfast, lunch, and grab-and-go foods. The owners are hands-on, going the extra mile to greet you and to ensure that your meal is a good experience. All servers wait on all diners, so you may be assisted by several people. You can enter from 330 S. Tryon St. or from the side street. Go early on the weekend--before people wake up and get there before you do.

z7YB7JMtmY_lvqiSqEy8ZA.text: On 9/15 my partner was served a blueberry stuffed french toast dish and found the bread to be molded. Reported it to the servers, I saw them show it to the manager Erin Green and her immediate response to the server was that it was just blueberry sauce and denied that it was mold. She barely looked at the dish. The blueberry filling was VERY clearly a vibrant purple color and was mainly towards the middle of the bread. The suspected mold was on the back edge of the bread, no filling was on the back corners, and it was an obvious greyish-green color and had a dusty/fuzzy texture, as most molds on bread do. We went ahead and paid the bill and left and declined their offer for another french toast, as my partner was no longer hungry but we still firmly believe that that was mold on the bread and not blueberry filling. It was blatantly obvious what it was yet it was denied. We were very polite about the situation but after reflecting i wish i would have said more and i feel as though we should have had atleast some compensation for the contaminated meal. Although their is not much to be done about it now, i thought that corporate should be aware of this location and the quality of food that they are serving consumers. The servers were all quite pleasant and polite but i felt as though the manager Erin Green who was on duty should have been more attentive to the situation and actually tried to look at the dish rather than immediately dismiss the issue and deny. She didnt even come speak to us. Someone needs to check the health standards of the kitchen. I understand things happen and bread molds but for it to be served to a customer is unacceptable. Someone in the kitchen was not being attentive to what they are plating and serving. I dont appreciate someone i love being served contaminated food.
